name: Updater
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
ExtractJob
Updater
description: Yielded to a block to accumulate changes for an API request.

methods.name: location=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
ExtractJob
Updater#location=
methods.description: Sets the geographic location where the job should run. Required except for US and EU.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/bigquery"

bigquery = Google::Cloud::Bigquery.new
dataset = bigquery.dataset "my_dataset"
table = dataset.table "my_table"

destination = "gs://my-bucket/file-name.csv"
extract_job = table.extract_job destination do |j|
  j.location = "EU"
end

extract_job.wait_until_done!
extract_job.done? #=> true

params.name: value
params.description:
A geographic location, such as “US”, “EU” or
“asia-northeast1”. Required except for US and EU.

params.name: value
params.description: The compression type to use for exported files. Possible values include GZIP and NONE. The default value is NONE.

params.name: value
params.description: Delimiter to use between fields in the exported data. Default is ,.

methods.name: format=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
ExtractJob
Updater#format=
methods.description:
Sets the destination file format. The default value is csv.

The following values are supported:

  • csv - CSV
  • json - Newline-delimited JSON
  • avro - Avro

methods.name: header=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
ExtractJob
Updater#header=
methods.description: Print a header row in the exported file.

params.name: value
params.description: Whether to print out a header row in the results. Default is true.

methods.name: labels=
title: Google
Cloud
Bigquery
ExtractJob
Updater#labels=
methods.description: Sets the labels to use for the job.

params.name: value
params.description:
A hash of user-provided labels associated with
the job. You can use these to organize and group your jobs. Label
keys and values can be no longer than 63 characters, can only
contain lowercase letters, numeric characters, underscores and
dashes. International characters are allowed. Label values are
optional. Label keys must start with a letter and each label in
the list must have a different key.
